intro: Thibaudia floribunda var. pichinchensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests.
